file_content.text: Hello? Please tell me someone won that firefight.
The Imperials are dead. The spaceport's secure.
The battle's over-- we won.
I just hope their dead equals ours.
Unless Colonel Marric wants to start fighting again, I'd say I did.
Do you really have to ask?
I'm no fool; I surrender.
Colonel Marric was respected and revered all over Balmorra. If word of this gets out, we'll lose face and that means losing support and manpower.
You coward! Weak and spineless, just like the Republic--
The colonel was once a hero. Let him die like one. Kill him and put him with the others. I'll say he fell in combat.
Killing the colonel won't bring your men back. He lives.
We're better than that.
I thank you for that. Maybe you can pass some of that spine over to Balmorra.
This isn't any worse than you deserve.
Done. [Kill Colonel Marric]
At least he did something to help us, in the end.
Despite the colonel's best efforts, you've won us the spaceport. Sobrik will be a battlefield for a few days, but we'll get it under control.
Meet me back at the Troida Workshop. I'll be waiting.
You've lost, Beke. Your men are dead and your ship's in flames.
What! How could you do this to us?
Here come your reinforcements. Ask them if you don't believe me.
You're standing with the Empire, Colonel.
I think I see a traitor.
Balmorra will too, before long.
Explain yourself.
We've been betrayed. Colonel Marric's joined the Empire.
All I see is a dead man and his idiot friends.
You'll pay for this.
Please, don't make this hard. Surrender or die. Those are your options.
You will answer for the resistance members you killed.
I'll give the orders here.
You're giving me too much credit. That's Imperial marksmanship.
Turning on your own people is the darkest path you can take.
Those men trusted you.
Leaving them weak and vulnerable is a shade darker.
You killed the Republic's allies. That makes you my enemy.
Duty is my only option.
I offered them the chance to join the Empire. When they refused, they became my enemies.
Here's a third option: Go to hell.
I'll give you one better.
I wouldn't expect a mercenary to understand.
What was your loyalty worth?
You haven't got a chance.
You haven't got a chance.
No soldier goes into battle expecting to fail.
When the Empire came, the Republic fought, lost and left.
Balmorra needs order, stability and power to survive. Our future is with the Empire.
Balmorra will be free, and you'll be remembered as a traitor.
Your future ends here.
Balmorra will thank me when this is over.
You can't truly believe that. Help me defeat the Imperials.
Don't do this, Colonel.
The Republic didn't learn anything from being outmatched. You're no different.
Please, spare me.
Hear that, Beke? Your backup's refused to surrender. Don't make the same mistake.
The Republic lost once, and they'll lose again. Get out while you still can.
Only the Colonel's left.
